title: 111_hr3299
content: The Act titled "Seed Availability and Competition Act of 2009" allows for the retention of patented seeds. The Act allows individuals to retain patented seeds by submitting notice and paying a fee to the Secretary of Agriculture. The fee is based on the type and quantity of seed retained, with collected amounts deposited into the Patented Seed Fund. Refunds may be issued at the discretion of the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of Agriculture may refund or adjust fees for retained seeds in cases of natural disasters. Collected fees are paid to patent holders from the Patented Seed Fund. This fund is established with amounts received by the Secretary. The Patented Seed Fund, administered by the Secretary of Agriculture, distributes moneys solely for payments to patent holders. Those retaining patented seed are not bound by contractual limitations or required to pay royalties. The term "patented seed" is defined in this section. The term "patented seed" refers to seed for which a person holds a valid patent. SEC. 3. TARIFF ON CERTAIN IMPORTED PRODUCTS. Tariff imposed on products of exported genetically modified seed to recover difference in fees charged in the United States and foreign countries. Duties collected will be deposited in the Patented Seed Fund. The Seed Fund, established to distribute duties collected on genetically modified seeds to patent holders, defines genetically modified seed and material as altered at the molecular level by non-natural means. The Seed Fund defines genetically modified seed as altered at the molecular level by non-natural means, excluding traditional breeding methods.
